list.title: Question 3
list.content: Letf(x)=(x−3)(x+1)f(x) = (x - 3)(x + 1)f(x)=(x−3)(x+1), forx∈Rx \in \mathbb{R}x∈R.For the graph offff, find:theyyy-intercept;[2]thexxx-intercepts;[2]the coordinates of the vertex.[3]

x &= -1,\hspace{0.25em} 3 \hspace{1.5em}\end{aligned}(x−3)(x+1)x​=0=−1,3​Hence thexxx-intercepts areB(−1,0)\answer{\mathrm{B}(-1,0)}B(−1,0)​andC(3,0)\answer{\mathrm{C}(3,0)}C(3,0)​Using the method of completing the square, we havef(x)=(x−3)(x+1)=x2−2x−3=[(x−1)2−1]−3=(x−1)2−4\begin{aligned}

are(1,−4)\answer{(1,-4)}(1,−4)​

list.title: Question 11
list.content:
A farmer is going to fence two equal adjacent parcels of land. These
parcels share one side (which also requires fencing) as shown in the
following diagram. The farmer has only808080metres of fence.

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/01d00c8e-3868-4639-a655-8216a79b9c4e/images/70cc4897-882c-489b-9551-58f6c2e26bb3/580f23d360211ad7dd2c45e79d30c7d9c7d24f56.svg)

Write down the equation for the total length of the fence,808080m, in terms ofxxxandyyy.[1]Write down the total area of both parcels of land in terms ofxxx.[2]Find the maximum area, in m2^22, of one parcel of land.[3]
list.markScheme:
80=3x+4y\answer{80 = 3x + 4y}80=3x+4y​The total area of both parcels of land in terms ofxxxisA(x)=x(2y)=2xy=2x(80−3x4)[from part (a)]=40x−32x2\begin{aligned}
\hspace{8em} A(x) &= x(2y) \\[18pt]
&= 2xy \\[11pt]
&= 2x\left(\dfrac{80 - 3x}{4}\right) \hspace{3em} [\text{from part (a)}] \\[7pt]
&\answer{= 40x - \dfrac{3}{2}x^2}\end{aligned}A(x)​=x(2y)=2xy=2x(480−3x​)[from part (a)]=40x−23​x2​​If we sketch the graph ofy=A(x)y = A(x)y=A(x)[by using G.D.C.], we have

![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/01d00c8e-3868-4639-a655-8216a79b9c4e/images/c3f7d568-52ea-4325-b521-9c031fcf4810/d34855549a850484b1041b3153951956e33882fa.svg)

Hence the maximum area of one parcel of land is266.672≈\dfrac{266.67}{2} \approx2266.67​≈133m2\answer{133 \text{ m}^2}133m2​

list.title: Question 12
list.content: Express2x2−8x+92x^2 - 8x + 92x2−8x+9in the forma(x+b)2+ca(x+b)^2 + ca(x+b)2+cwherea,b,c∈Za,b,c \in\mathbb{Z}a,b,c∈Z.[2]Given thatf(x)=x−2f(x) = x - 2f(x)=x−2and(g∘f)(x)=2x2−8x+9(g\circ f)(x) = 2x^2 - 8x + 9(g∘f)(x)=2x2−8x+9, findg(x)g(x)g(x).[3]
list.markScheme:
Using the method of completing the square, we get2x2−8x+9=2[x2−4x]+9=2[(x−2)2−4]+9=2(x−2)2−8+9=2(x−2)2+1\begin{aligned}
2x^2 - 8x + 9 &= 2\big[x^2 - 4x\big] + 9 \\[6pt]
&= 2\big[(x-2)^2 - 4\big] + 9 \hspace{2em} \\[6pt]
&= 2(x-2)^2 - 8 + 9 \\[6pt]
&\answer{= 2(x-2)^2 + 1}\end{aligned}2x2−8x+9​=2[x2−4x]+9=2[(x−2)2−4]+9=2(x−2)2−8+9=2(x−2)2+1​​We have(g∘f)(x)=2x2−8x+9g(f(x))=2(x−2)2+1[by part (a)]g(x−2)=2(x−2)2+1[sincef(x)=x−2]\begin{aligned}
\hspace{8.3em} (g\circ f)(x) &= 2x^2 - 8x + 9 \\[6pt]
g(f(x)) &=  2(x-2)^2 + 1 \hspace{3em} [\text{by part (a)}] \\[6pt]
g(x-2) &= 2(x-2)^2 + 1 \hspace{3em} [\text{since $f(x) = x - 2$}] \\
\end{aligned}(g∘f)(x)g(f(x))g(x−2)​=2x2−8x+9=2(x−2)2+1[by part (a)]=2(x−2)2+1[sincef(x)=x−2]​g(x)=2x2+1\answer{g(x) = 2x^2 + 1} \hspace{3.4em}g(x)=2x2+1​
